title: Ticket #5676: Condor week demo for job factory for 8.5 series
description:
Schedd needs demo quality code to show the job factory for HTCondor Week 2016.

This code will be committed to the V8_5-job_factory branch.
remarks:
2016-May-15 16:29:53 by johnkn:
with [43882] the job factory works for jobs that only need ClusterId, ProcId, Cluster, Process, Row and Step to instantate jobs correctly.

The following submit file works on TJ's machine, changes to paths will be needed to make it work on other machines. submit using the following command: 

condor_submit factory_sleep.sub -queue 6

The initial Queue command determines how many jobs will be keep instantiated in the schedd. 

factory_sleep.sub 
# a sleep job for windows
executable=c:\tools\sleepw.exe
transfer_executable=false
SLEEP_SEC = 10 + $(ROW) * 2 + $(Step)
arguments = $INT(SLEEP_SEC)s /q
log=sleep.log
#out=sleep.out
#error=sleep.err
#should_transfer_files=no
#when_to_transfer_output=NEVER
#Requirements = TARGET.FileSystemDomain == "crane.cs.wisc.edu"
# +FileSystemDomain="crane.cs.wisc.edu"

# Factory attributes
MY.JobFactoryNumProcs = 60
MY.JobFactorStepSize = 6;
MY.JobFactorySubmitFile = "d:\scratch\condor\alt\test\jobs\factory\factory_sleep.sub"

2016-May-16 22:35:26 by johnkn:
commit [48385] adds $(SUBMIT_FILE) to the config hashtable. and also a hack that puts experimental job factory attributes into the job if max_materialise is set and > 0
check_ins:
2016-May-16 15:04   Check-in [48385]: hacked up version of condor_submit for use with factory demo #5676 this condor submit will create a factory submit when it sees the max_materialize statement in the submit file. (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
2016-May-15 16:22   Check-in [48382]: Initial commit of demo quality code for the schedd job factory. #5676 (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
creator: johnkn
